channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Cold Pool Lane - consider no right turn, 11th September
item.description:
Each morning, Cold Pool Lane is full of queuing cars due to the railway bridge closure. As the railway bridge is going to be months before repair and the road is open, please consider traffic exiting cold Pool Lane as left turn only and block off right turn. The traffic build up in the lane is purely down to cars who want to turn right but are unable too due to amount of traffic on main road. Making it left turn only would make the lane free flowing and anyone wanting to turn right can go upto the roundabout and back on themselves.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cold Pool Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Speed bump has broken up., 11th September
item.description:
Speed bump which is across both lanes has broken up on side going out of Cleeve. Also same side of speed bump on other lane, is quite a violent drop even at max speed of 10 mph - recently had car spring fail. And single bump previous to this on side coming into Cleeve is breaking up on kerb side.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Station Road, Tewkesbury

item.title: Two huge potholes in entrance to Six ways council car park between tall pillars so no way of avoiding them., 11th September
item.description:
Between pillars in entrance from London road to six ways council car park and recycling area. Also leads to back of chemist, Drs surgery and childrens facility This has been there for months and every car that enters the car park is at risk of damage to its tyres or suspension.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakhurst Rise, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: Flooding, trip & slip hazard, 11th September
item.description:
Large dip in pavement and tree root blocking drainage from outside no.10 Leckhampton Road. Large amounts of leaves collect underneath tree, which rot and create a major trip and slip hazards especially when it has been raining. The puddle created is ginormous when it rains. Issue has been present since July 2023.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Traffic island in humber road / avon road untidy, 11th September
item.description:
Island in humber road / Avon Road is very untidy with litter and overgrown weeds . This has been reported to both highways and the local council and nothing has been done. Rodents have also been seen in amongst the weeds.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 59, Humber Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Collapsed manhole, cordoned off since 2023, 11th September
item.description:
On a road traffic island on the junction of Royal Well Road and Royal Well Place, there is a collapsed manhole cover which has been recognised as precarious and potentially hazardous because it has been cordoned off by barriers since last year. But nothing has been done about the hole and because the barriers are precariously positioned on the edge of the island, I have regularly found them collapsed and/or on the busy road itself. When the latter happens, the barriers are more dangerous than the hole they are supposedly protecting. On Monday, I found the manhole cover unprotected, the barriers on the opposite pavement and virtually all of the sandbags designed to keep the barriers in place have now split and therr is sand every where. I have taken numerous pictures but can't upload them all here. I have reassembled the barriers for approximately the 4th time over the past year.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Royal Well Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 11th September
item.description:
Customer has called in to reports concerns about height of trees along Battledown Approach. States they have grown very tall and are concerned that they are unsafe and need topping as they will be too large soon.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vision difficulties leaving homes 71 - 77 Moorend Rd, 11th September
item.description:
The above 4 houses are set back from Moorend Rd and exiting from here on to Moorend Rd is extremely dangerous. Even when great care is taken by very slowly edging out it is impossible to be fully aware of approaching cyclists and fast drivers passing. We are dependent on other drivers to be aware of us. A mirror or some means of observing oncoming traffic would be very helpful or a method of slowing down or making other drivers aware of our exit.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Moorend Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 11th September
item.description:
> I live in the main house at Ellingham House, 79 Pittville Lawn, GL52 2BP. There is a large tree on the street outside the drive and the problem is that the branches are overhanging the property to a large degree, by many metres. As well as bird fouling, of more concern is the sometimes sizeable chunks of foliage that come down particularly in bad weather. These are large enough to have potential to damage cars, and, more worryingly, my children or other passers-by. I have even stopped parking my car in that part of my drive because of this worry. > > I have attached three photos below, one from the front of the property, one from the side to show the overhang of the lower branches, and one from on the property (coincidentally at a time when you could see recently shed foliage from the tree in the photo, though this is relatively small compared to some that have come down). > > I would be grateful if someone could arrange to cut the overhang of the upper and lower branches right back so that they are clear of my property boundary.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faulty pedestrian sensor causing A40 Westbound Red Lights for no reason, 10th September
item.description:
Presumably a faulty pedestrian crossing sensor is causing the A40 Westbound slip road into Benhall to turn red at every sequence This is happening all day, every day even when there are no pedestrians or cyclists anywhere near The completely unnecessary red lights are delaying buses using the bus lane and traffic turning into Benhall, increasing noise and pollution. The filter lane should only ever turn red when the pedestrian crossing has been activated. Instead it turns red on schedule with each sequence of the main carriageway lights. This has been occurring since the A40 bodged cycleway work was conducted by Bodgeit, Bashit and Scarper Construction over a year ago.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Lights are red for no reason
